description: Square array T(n, k) read by antidiagonals, n > 0 and k > 0: for any number n > 0, let f(n) be the function that associates k to the prime(k)-adic valuation of n (where prime(k) denotes the k-th prime); f establishes a bijection between the positive numbers and the arithmetic functions with nonnegative integer values and a finite number of nonzero values; let g be the inverse of f; T(n, k) = g(f(n) * f(k)) (where i * j denotes the Dirichlet convolution of i and j).
